alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Pleasants; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:52AM EST until January 11 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following counties, Doddridge, Pleasants and Tyler. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 245 AM EST, Heavy rainfall has ended, gauge reports still show river levels are at minor flood stage but does appear to be cresting. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Marys, Middlebourne, Paden City, Sistersville, West Union, Friendly, Alma, Lima, Canton, Wick, Smithburg, Hebron, Blandville, Center Point, New Milton, Arvilla, Point Lookout and Avon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
